alert.note: Alert for Clark; Hot Spring; Montgomery; Pike (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 18 at 1:56AM CDT until June 18 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT FOR CLARK...EASTERN PIKE...NORTHWESTERN OUACHITA...SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY AND SOUTHWESTERN HOT SPRING COUNTIES... At 155 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Glenwood to Okolona to 7 miles northwest of Rosston, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Arkadelphia... Glenwood... Gurdon... Amity... Caddo Valley... Chidester... Okolona... Whelen Springs... Beirne... Gum Springs in Clark County... Poison Springs State Park... White Oak Lake State Park... Halfway... Richwoods... DeGray Lake State Park... Delight... Friendship... Bismarck... Antoine... Alpine... THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
